message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We use two complementary datasets in this analysis: census data from the United States Census Bureau and data on gasoline prices from the Energy Information Administration.", "dataset": ["United States Census Bureau", "Energy Information Administration"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Telecommunications Union (ITU), we show that internet access is positively associated with economic growth.", "dataset": ["International Telecommunications Union (ITU)"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "A study based on panel data from the Global Findex suggests that the adoption of digital financial services leads to higher levels of financial inclusion.", "dataset": ["Global Findex"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This paper examines the relationship between corruption and economic growth using data on corruption perception index from Transparency International and GDP from the World Bank.", "dataset": ["Transparency International", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Governance", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Our study uses multiple datasets, including household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys Program and administrative data from the Ministry of Education to analyze the effect of schooling on child health in rural areas.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys Program", "Ministry of Education"], "topic": ["Education", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "The effects of nutrition interventions on human capital formation are studied using a dataset that combines demographic and dietary information from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and cognitive and educational outcomes from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Education"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the effect of foreign aid on gender development using gender statistics from the World Bank and AidData database.", "dataset": ["World Bank", "AidData"], "topic": ["Gender"]}, {"sentence": "To evaluate the effectiveness of public-private partnerships in infrastructure development, we use a dataset that combines information on PPP projects from the World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure Database and data on infrastructure performance from the Infrastructure Consortium for Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure Database", "Infrastructure Consortium for Africa"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This article examines the relationship between renewable energy production and economic growth using data on renewable energy consumption from the International Energy Agency and GDP from the World Development Indicators.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Energy", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use data on conflict events from the Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED) and public opinion polls from Afrobarometer to investigate the determinants of political violence in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}]
